name: Along The River Isar
description: Munich’s lifeblood is and has always been the river Isar. It runs from the Karwendelgebirge roughly 300km to the north and flows into the Danube in the city of Deggendorf. The fourth largest Bavarian river, it was once used as an important trade route by the raftsmen. We will follow the Isar for some time from Bad Tölz to Munich.
